channel.title: "We serve the same mystery"
channel.description: Although I am in Ravenholm on my HL2 first-play I've remembered something. Near the begining of the game there was a Vortigaunt and a dude in a train compartment. On the TV GMan was making his mysterious appearance. After I've done talking with the dude, the Vortigaunt said: "We serve the same mystery". Could this mean that GMan is also shown to the vorigaunt/the whole vortigaunt species(or whatever)? Or was he just talking gibberish?

item.title: "We serve the same mystery"
item.dc:creator: mental2k
item.description:
JeffMOD:

(Well, this is embarassing to have to explain…)
I was being sarcastic, because it being a reference to the chapter is kinda obvious, seeing as they’re the exact same words and all. :hmph:

Yes, I got the sarcasm, it appears mine was too subtle, lol.

Read full topic

item.description:
Yeah even though it’s vague, we know what we’e talking about. :retard:

item.title: "We serve the same mystery"
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Lamarr is in space right now. Kleiner says that there is a weight anomaly in the rocket before they fire it & it’s not caused by the gnome. Magnusson says that the anomaly is “within tolerance” which is half-life for “shit is about to go horribly wrong.” Not long AFTER this is said, Magnusson also says that if anything does go wrong, the best they can hope is that the rocket lands on the combine. I think it’s safe to assume that the rocket will crash at some point in ep3, and that Lamarr will come out unscathed.

Read full topic

item.title: "We serve the same mystery"
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
I don’t think the G-Man was talking about Eli’s death. He said “unforseen consequences”. What was the advisors attacking a consequence of? Except maybe closing the portal, but everyone would have died anyway if it hadn’t been closed.

Also, I seriously doubt Lamarr is dead. I’d bet money on her randomly turning up again in Ep3.

Read full topic

item.title: "We serve the same mystery"
item.dc:creator: mechaelite
item.description:
russilker:

…I think he was talking about Eli dying… which is why the message was to him…

well, also could be the borealis because Mossman’s message showed an expedition at the artic. It could be a message for Eli but the Combine got the transmission before. After all, he knew what the borealis means: ‘‘No, Another Black Mesa no…’’ -Eli.

Read full topic

item.title: "We serve the same mystery"
item.dc:creator: Jotie
item.description:
GothicFighter:

I’ve installed Nightmare House 1 and Minerva for now. They both look interesting.

One thing bothers me. [COLOR=‘Red’]SPOILERSPOILERSPOILER
When the vorts save Alyx and Gman takes that opportunity to talk to you/her, he says to Alyx to tell her father (Eli) “Prepare for unforseen consequences” while he was near the rocket. Now, as you know, the rocket launched well, the super portal is destroyed, everyone is happy(well, almost, as Eli dies). So, was there an “unforseen consequence” I’ve missed or it will appear on EP3/future Half Life games(maybe something related to Borealis)? Oh, and let me get one thing straight. Is Lammar dead?
[COLOR=‘Red’]SPOILERSPOILERSPOILER

I think G-Man is talking about the borealis.

Read full topic

item.title: "We serve the same mystery"
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Lamarr didn’t die.

When she went up into the portal storm, she was transported into a growth chamber being worked on by the Combine.

You will meet her again at the end of Episode Three, where she is the size of the Gene Worm…as the final boss.

Read full topic
